The Largest Aerial Transportation Company in the World Operating Flying Boats

New York City
General Information for Passengers
RESERVATIONS.-Seats can be reserved and
LIQUOR LAWS.— Importation of liquor is
tickets purchased at any Tourist Agency or Travel

can be obtained by telegraphic request direct to our

WAR TAX.— War tax is payable on all tickets
$3.00 per head.
CHILDREN.-Between the ages of seven and
Đ D
BAGGAGE.-Each passenger is allowed thirty
(30) pounds of personal baggage.
Any baggage m
excess of this amount is charged for under a fixed
reasonable tann.
Trunks and other heavy baggage
may be forwarded by steamer the same day.
FLYING CLOTHES.-Travel in the cabins of
the flying cruisers is equal in comfort to that in a
Pullman car, except there is no dust or grime. Pas-
senders wear their orainary croues
No leather
garments, goggles or other paraphernalia are neces-
sary in Aeromarine cruisers.
CUSTOMS.- Baggage is cleared both inwards and
outwards at Aeromarine floats by Customs officers
specially detailed to our service.
fifteen travel for half fare.

citizens-aliens must be supplied with passports.

AEROMARINE AERIAL SCENIC TOURS
Aerial flights over Florida's most beautiful scenery
The quickest, safest and most delightful means of viewing
these and hundreds of other interesting sights, is from
the air.
